H0.text: Make their own food is why plants are producers.

H1.text: Can grow in soil is why plants are considered producers.

H2.text: Need water to grow is the reason plants are producers.

H3.text: Plants are producers because they take in nutrients.

A4.text: Thus, the bulk of a plant's biomass comes from the inputs of photosynthesis, not the soil itself.

A5.text: The basic reaction by which organisms use photosynthesis to produce food (such as glucose) was outlined.
